page.title: 04PENZANCE RAILWAY STATION
page.content:
The 1st.station was built in 1852.The trains then could only go to Truro and back.The second was completed on 19th. of November,1879.There are four platforms for people,and one for cars and cargo.There is one restaurant and a train examiner who checks the trains before they leave.There are 10 travel centre people, 45 drivers, 22 guards, 7 shunters, 11 porters and 31 carriage cleaners. The 1st.class trains have a yellow line along the top.The manager and Mr.Paul,a driver,like the new trains. One train we saw was called Agincourt. The manager works in the day, and he has a lot of paper-work.The platforms are made of granite. Alv.
Penzance station is a terminus, which means that it the last on the line.
